item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

        if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("dice")) {
            int dice = (misc.random(100));
            PlayerHandler.messageToAll = {playerName + " has just rolled " + dice + " on their 55x2 dice and " + (dice >= 56 ? "Player" : "Host") + " WINS!"};
        }

Converting if statements into if-ternary statements - A short tutorial. - MoparScape

item.title: ::dice 55x2 command for [Allstar]
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“sertan8, post:9, topic:540429”]what exactly is that, mind explaining?

i’m also not sure what that questionmark means in the code[/quote]

It is a short hand version of the if-else statement into a ternary operator.
basically (A ? B : C)
translates to

if (A) { B; } else { C; }
Most commonly would shorten being assigned a value like this

if (Boosting) { playerSpeed = 2.0; } else { playerSpeed = 1.0; }
converted to ternary operator would look like this.
playerSpeed = (Boosting ? 2.0 : 1.0);

Read full topic

@matzie wrote:

or

Making use of the format feature, to avoid creating 3 strings. Or better to use a string buffer, but in this case it could be a waste. To initialize one, instead use what that created.

item.title: ::dice 55x2 command for [Allstar]
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

OP please learn the significance of brackets and braces, this is the second time you have done this now.

[code=java]if (command.equals(“dice”)) {
int roll = new Random().nextInt(100);

PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName + " has just rolled " + roll
              + " on their 55x2 dice and " + (dice >= 55 ? "Player" : "Host") + " wins!";

}[/code]

ps I would declare and initialize random outside of the local scope.

item.title: ::dice 55x2 command for [Allstar]
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

So simple not even worthy really of a snippet but still your code doesn’t follow proper conventions.

never use an if statement like this

and you should be using an else here.

if (command.equals("dice")) { final int dice = new Random().nextInt(99); if (dice >= 54) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = ("" + playerName + " has just rolled " + dice + " on their 55x2 dice and Player WINS!"); } else { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = ("" + playerName + " has just rolled " + dice + " on their 55x2 dice and Host WINS!"); } }

Read full topic

item.title: ::dice 55x2 command for [Allstar]
item.dc:creator: @dylaster5 dylaster5
item.description:
@dylaster5 wrote:

This is a basic dice command that sends a message to everyone on what you rolled and says if host win or player win. you can easily change the odds.
This can also be converted into a delta by editing it a bit

[code] if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“dice”)) {

    int dice = (misc.random(100));

    {if (dice >= 56 )
	
	PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (""+playerName+" has just rolled "+dice+" on their 55x2 dice and Player WINS!");
	}

	{
	if (dice <= 55 )
	

	PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (""+playerName+" has just rolled "+dice+" on their 55x2 dice and Host WINS!");
	}
    	
	
}[/code]

Read full topic
